wrath.util

Class Logger

  • java.lang.Object
    • wrath.util.Logger

  • public class Logger
extends java.lang.Object
    Flexible and expandable logging system. Includes Time stamps, console verbose and file logging.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Logger(java.lang.String loggerName)
      The name of the logger.
      Logger(java.lang.String loggerName, boolean verboseToConsole, boolean writeToFile)
      The name of the logger.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the Logger and its output streams.
      static Logger getErrorLogger()
      Gets the standard output stream/logging object to report errors to console and file.
      boolean isClosed()
      Returns true if the logger has been closed and can no longer be accessed, otherwise false.
      void log(java.lang.String message)
      To write to the console, depending on Logger options, it will write to console and/or file.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Logger

        public Logger(java.lang.String loggerName)
        The name of the logger. The file will be (root)/etc/logs/(name).log
        Parameters:
        loggerName - The name of the Logger

      • Logger

        public Logger(java.lang.String loggerName,
              boolean verboseToConsole,
              boolean writeToFile)
        The name of the logger. The file will be (root)/etc/logs/(name).log
        Parameters:
        loggerName - The name of the Logger
        verboseToConsole - specifies whether this logger writes to console.
        writeToFile - specifies whether this logger writes out to a file.

    • Method Detail

      • getErrorLogger

        public static Logger getErrorLogger()
        Gets the standard output stream/logging object to report errors to console and file.
        Returns:
        Returns the Standard error logger

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the Logger and its output streams.

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Returns true if the logger has been closed and can no longer be accessed, otherwise false.
        Returns:
        Returns whether or not the logger has been closed.

      • log

        public void log(java.lang.String message)
        To write to the console, depending on Logger options, it will write to console and/or file. Timestamping and prefixing will be done automatically.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to write.
